intro: Pseudolysimachion linariifolium f. album, commonly known as the white-flowered linariifolium, is a variant of the species characterized by its pale to white flower color. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. The plant typically features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in early summer. This form is noted for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
